intro: Caucaea universitas-cuencae, commonly known as the Cuenca university plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
